
### Tag-Index-Offset exercise  {.smaller}

<table>
<tr><td>$m$</td><td>memory addreses bits (Y86-64: 64)</td></tr>
<tr><td>$E$</td><td>number of blocks per set (‘‘ways’’)</td></tr>
<tr><td>$S=2^s$</td><td>number of sets</td></tr>
<tr><td>$s$</td><td>(set) index bits</td></tr>
<tr><td>$B=2^b$</td><td>block size</td></tr>
<tr><td>$b$</td><td>(block) offset bits</td></tr>
<tr><td>$t = m - (s+b)$</td><td>tag bits</td></tr>
<tr><td>$C = B \times{} S \times{} E$</td><td>cache size (excluding metadata)</td></tr>
</table>
  

* My desktop: 

   * L1 Data Cache: 32 KB, 8 blocks/set, 64 byte blocks
   * L2 Cache: 256 KB, 4 blocks/set, 64 byte blocks
   * L3 Cache: 8 MB, 16 blocks/set, 64 byte blocks
 

   * Divide the address <code>0x34567</code> into <em>tag</em>, <em>index</em>, <em>offset</em> for each cache.
